Man könnte noch viele weitere positive Sachen finden und aufzählen, aber das soll es für hier gewesen sein :)

Unterm Strich kann ich allen nur empfehlen hier zu übernachten wenn man einen NYC Trip plant.

Seriös, hilfsbereit und immer(!) erreichbar - so macht AirBnB Spaß!

Staying in bedstuy was an absolutely wonderful. The neighborhood bias clean, not to loud, and had plenty available via bus, train, or if you got the legs to walk. The place was warm, modern, and cozy. The bed was slightly too squeaky and the baby upstairs running around didn't help much. The kitchen was nicely sized to have a great dinner. The bathroom was clean and just right to get the job done. It just so happen to snow while we were there and the backyard was perfect for the snowball fight.

Alex was a wonderful host!
He made sure we were set and comfortable right at the start. Myself and my girlfriend enjoyed the place since it is comfortable for two people only. I did wish only a few things which is an upgraded bed ( felt comfortable but the frame felt like it was ready to snap lol ) it was a daily adventure to sleep on a risky level and secondly would be the options of having more kitchenware (more pans, larger coffee cups, etc) we cooked at the place most of the time since we were on a budget and all. 
With that said, we had everything else we needed which is great! 
I recommend Alex's place to anyone of course.

Shaila and Alex were wonderful hosts, and we had an amazing stay at their apartment! It was clean, bright and had everything we needed for the week. They were very generous to lend us a pack & play, stroller and toys for our 11 month old, which made travelling with a baby such a breeze. The neighbourhood was really interesting, the people were friendly, and we would love to stay again.

Alex and Shaila were awesome!  We survived the New York "blizzard" (ha!) here and were happy to hunker down in such a big space.  It's a lovely spot, just as pictured, and the bed is super comfy.  I'd say the only drawback is that you are on the ground floor with the sound traveling a good deal through the ceiling from the apartment above (where Alex and Shaila live with their adorable 2-year-old).  So when the little tike is running around above you, you know it.  Not a big deal, just something you might want to know.   Overall, great experience and really good value for this place.

Alex & Shaila were brilliant hosts! They were so helpful with info. about the area & even helped us order take out because we couldn't use our UK phones!
The area was lovely, a little bit out of busy Brooklyn (Williamsburg etc.) but this was easily accessible by bus (20-30min total journey). You can see the area is really up & coming with some lovely little eateries, a wine bar and a bakery all 10 mins walk from the stay. Alex & Shaila were helpful in pointing these out. We were really happy with our stay and would not hesitate to recommend or even stay again ourselves.
The apartment is very clean and spacious. Alex is a good and professional host. I did not use the kitchen but it was also roomy and clean.

Alex was a good host. He made sure we were well settled in from the start and provided us with a small guide of his favourite places around Bed-Stuy (restos, bars, cafes, etc.). The place was exactly as described and as pictured. Very nice place, modern stove that was awesome to cook with, and comfortable bed after long days of roaming around NYC. My boyfriend and I were traveling to Manhattan and within Brooklyn, and public transit was not a problem. We also never felt in danger coming back at night. You will definitely hear their toddler running around and playing on the above floor but it was not a big issue for us. Also, the kitchen equipment was of very good quality, but not high in number (for example, only the necessary pots were available, which was  sufficient for us). Overall, we were very happy with our stay.

Väldigt fin och rymlig lägenhet, uppfyllde alla förväntningar.
Alex & Shaila var jätte trevliga och hjälpsamma, rekomenderas starkt!

Alex and Shaila were brilliant hosts, helpful, easy to contact and friendly. They lent us a cot, baby bath and toys for our small son, which were much appreciated. The apartment is as stylish as pictured and is spotlessly clean, with nice quirky details. Electric appliances in particular are top quality if you cook in the apartment. The area is cool with useful shops and restaurants, and the A train goes straight into the heart of Manhattan in about 30 minutes. Two mild things to note: as a previous reviewer said you can hear footfall and noise from the apartment above but that didn't bother us, and there were some ants in the kitchen/main room, but it is on the ground floor so no biggy. We would definitely stay there again. Thanks so much! Nat, Ivan and Albert

This was perfect for our trip which
was to visit friends in NYC. Alex was polite and his guide to the neighborhood helpful.

What you see is what you get!!! In de wijk Brooklyn een ruim, schoon appartement. Voor vragen konden we altijd bij onze gastheer Alex terecht. We hadden het fijn gevonden als we na een dag stad een plekje in de tuin hadden kunnen krijgen.
Het was even wennen aan de vnl. zwarte wijk. Iedereen vriendelijk en we voelden ons op ons gemak.
Door de goede bus- en metroverbindingen is Manhattan op ruim een half uur reizen bereikbaar.

Nous avons été très surpris du voisinage très peu accueillant voire peu rassurant, le soir. La station de métro est à 10 minutes à pied, ce qui nécessite de traverser des quartiers pas très bien fréquentés. 

L'accueil d'Alex a été cordial. L'appartement était relativement propre et bien entretenu. 

Beaucoup de bruits, tard le soir et tôt le matin, difficile de bien dormir si vous avez le sommeil léger (mauvaise insonorisation).

El apartamento es precioso,limpio y con todo lo que se necesita.
Alex fue muy simpatico y servicial.
Tiene el metro cerca, la linea a que te deja en el centro.
Estuvimos 1 semana y fue todo genial.
Si es cierto que al estar debajo se oyen ruidos al caminar pero no era muy molesto.

L'appartement est propre et tout à fait conforme aux photos et à sa description. L'appartement est très spacieux et la cuisine très bien équipée même si je n'ai pas vraiment eu l'occasion de m'en servir. 
A savoir qu'il n'y a pas de volets aux fenêtres si vous aimez dormir dans le noir (mais peut être que c'est partout aux US), aussi on entends les bruits du dessus ou vivent Alex & Shaila. Je ne les ai croisés qu'une fois et ils sont très sympa et arrangeants (j'ai pu laisser ma valise le dernier jour car mon avion était tard).
Le quartier est très résidentiel et il n'y a pas beaucoup de choses à y faire. Alex & Shaila avaient préparé un petit guide de quoi faire aux alentours mais je n'ai pas forcément eu l'occasion de l'utiliser.
Le quartier peut paraître peut accueillant au début mais je n'ai jamais été embêtée. On m'a conseillé de ne pas rentrer seule de nuit, j'ai donc suivi ce conseil mais je ne sais pas si ça craignait vraiment...
La ligne de métro A est à 5-10min à pieds elle est plutôt pratique car il s'agit d'une ligne express. En taxi depuis la 5ème avenue (niveau 50eme) il faut compter environ 30$ pour rentrer, les taxis ne veulent pas toujours y aller car ils ne connaissent pas très bien Brooklyn alors que c'est très simple (sachez qu'il est normalement interdit aux taxis de vous refuser)
Joli petit appartement bien équipé, dans un quartier relativement tranquille.

Hosts were responsive, helpful, and flexible. Answered all questions immediately and volunteered all the help they could provide. Allowed late check out. Neighborhood was very cool and off the beaten path. Sound of people walking above us didn't concern us. Especially since the night time was super quiet.

We've enjoyed 13 nights at Shaila & Alex's apartment in Brooklyn - it was exactly as described and as pictured. The space was perfect for us - very clean with good facilities and comfortable beds, and only minutes to walk to the subway. Shaila and Alex were very friendly and welcoming and responded quickly to our queries. I would highly recommend this property - great value all around. Thank you. Cristian and Juliana

Amazing experience at the apartment, really big space and comfy bed, great kitchen living space with all the equipment and much needed air con units! Area of Brooklyn is good, sometimes can be a little loud with music in surrounding houses. Be prepared to be woken early with noise from above apartment. felt safe never had any problems, really quick walk to Utica Av (A) subway straight to Manhatten in 25 mins, little longer back in the evenings, subway full even at 11/12 at night. Check in and out process was easy and we were left good New York guides and neighbourhood guides. Loved the whole experience!

The pictures are exactly what you see when you go in. Very cool decoration, and spacious. The bed is very comfortable and cozy. Alex was very helpful and had great restaurants suggestions. There is great organic and locally grown cafe/lunch/dinner and market just two blocks away from the apartment. A few minutes walk from the subway. We enjoyed our stay.

I set up a friend who needed a place to stay on short notice, and Shaila and Alex were very quick to respond, very helpful. Their instructions about how to get there, and what to eat and see in the neighborhood, were very clear. My friend loved the apartment and said it was "perfect."

We had a great time staying in the apartment. It had everything we needed and was a short walk to the A train express. It is a great place to stay if you want to explore Brooklyn and check out the local spots, as well as having easy access to Manhattan. We didn't notice much noise from above, though the bed is a little creaky. Some great bars and restaurants nearby, we recommend Peaches, doughnuts from Dough, tacos from Oaxaca and Glorietta Baldy for beer/cocktails. Great value for NYC!

Everything was excactly as Shaila and Alex said it would be. Had a minor panic trying to get in after midnight on our arrival but resolved it really quickly. Apartment was perfect, spacious and clean.

We had a great time in the apartment of Shaila & Alex. The apartment is clean and as described. We found everything we needed and received all necessary information in advance plus a nice neighborhood-guide. The A train to Manhattan and to the airport is really close by which makes it a perfect location to explore NYC.

Thanks to Shaila & Alex!

Nice apartment in good location near subway stations so it was easy to get to/from Manhattan and also JFK. Shaila and Alex provided a really useful guide to the local area with eating and drinking recommendations. We found a couple that could possibly be added to that list! Manny's on the corner of Macon St and Patchen Ave is great for breakfast, and Daddy Green's on Malcolm X Blvd does amazing pizza.

Alex was helpful and responsive. I landed at the La Guardia airport early in the morning and asked him to leave my bags about at 9 am. He kindly said, yes. When I arrived his house, he warmly welcomed and tried to teach how to reach downtown and other places. The house was big enough for two people but little bit small bathroom. Overall, I liked the house, except unhygienic towels and a huge insect I saw.

Alex and Shailas place was beautiful! I really enjoyed staying there. They were very accommodating to my needs and I felt very comfortable staying there. It was super easy getting to the train and around New York. Would definitely recommend staying here!

Alex was very helpful and friendly - his guide is great and he let us leave our luggage for our last day so we didn't have to carry it round. The flat is exactly as you see it in the pictures and the street is beautiful and we found the neighbourhood very friendly.  Saraghina just down the road has amazing cocktails and the best pizzas we've ever had! The subway was really full every time we got it but it's a good place to explore from if you want a quiet place to come back to.

Sadly we were really unhappy about two things: the bed, which we found really uncomfortable - it also squeaked like crazy and seemed like it was about to fall apart. Also (you could argue we should have read the reviews better) there was a lot of noise from upstairs from 7.30 in the morning.  Being on holiday, this was pretty annoying! Obviously we understand that it can't be totally soundproof but at points it sounded like someone was trying to hammer through the roof. So you should definitely be aware that you won't be getting a lie in!

Since the beginning Shaila & Alex were very kind with me. They answered all my questions very fast.
The apartment is exactly what you see in the pictures. The bed is very comfortable and the kitchen is pretty good to make some food after an exhausting day.
The neighborhood is good and safety. The best thing is that the apartment is near by 2 subway stations and even in the winter is easy to get there. I totally recommend for you to stay there.
Tips: if you have problems with noise to sleep, take with you some ear plugs - the apartment is  on the bottom where the family lives and they wake up early, so you can hear the steps.

Mouldy food in the fridge.
Dishwasher full of dirty dishes.
Come home to Sheila in the apartment on our second day and was obviously not expecting us home, she was flustered and said there was a bad smell in the cupboard before we had arrived she was trying to get rid of. It clearly states that if they needed to access the basement which the door is in the apartment we were in they would give plenty of notice but we hadn't got anything except to our surprise when we walked in the door everything was open and she was roaming around. It was a massive invasion of privacy. 
We had our stuff everywhere obviously just getting off a long flight and wanting to get straight out.
I had a few packages which I had told them well in advance that they would be arriving and to hold onto them. One was open when I recieved them, even though it clearly had my name on it and they had been expecting them. 
Alex is up at crazy hours doing dishes and walking around which sounds like an elephant clashing plates right next to your ears. The noise travels and is super loud. To be woken up at between 12 and 3am every night was becoming a joke. We kindly went up to ask to keep it down as the kitchen is obviously right above the bedroom he was super rude and tried telling us no one was up. But then the next day said he was up at that time. They obviously have no idea how loud it really is. And to be disturbed every single night. Who is up at 1am clashing dishes around honestly.
Then you can never sleep in and make up for the broken sleep as the child is up screaming running and thudding so loud at 7am 

Day 5 Alex come down as someone was knocking on out door apparently to check the electricals 
No warning just entered and barged straight through the door and I had just gotten out of the shower. Again massive invasion of privacy!
Our last night we thought we would get a proper rest for once before our flight, to my surprise wheelie bins were being dragged and rubbish bags going through it was so loud I thought there was a homeless person rummaging through the trash, nope just Alex at 1230 in the morning making more noise right out our window.

I think it was becoming entertainment for him haha such a joke I have honestly never experienced anything like this and if I had read a review that explained how noisy it was from above and that you can literally hear word for word the conversations had I would have passed straight past the ad.

We found and booked this listing within the same week of our visit. Shaila and Alex were very responsive to our questions.

We enjoyed staying at Shaila and Alex's apt very much - the listing was just as described and it was a lovely way to spend a few days. Although we didn't get to meet our hosts, they were still very much involved in ensuring that our stay was comfortable. Every concern we had was addressed within the hour.

The apt has such a simple and carefree personality. It's the perfect place to relax in after a day of exploring the city.

The only downside about the stay was the wifi connection. It was a little difficult to connect, as the signal was weak. However, the nearby Saraghina has a great wifi connection and amazing food.
Alex and Shaila were hospitable. Any questions, I had or favors that I needed, were answered and met. They gave me privacy while still living upstairs.

Interacted once with Alex when we checked in. He was kind enough to let us drop off our bags after our flight arrived in the morning. Besides that, limited interaction. The space is clean and spacious. Great home base if most of your time will be spent in Brooklyn. Great to be near the A and C train. Neighborhood beautiful with lots of great places to eat. Only downside was hearing walking through the ceiling above, which is hard to avoid in NYC apartments.
I had a great time during my stay here. They were incredibly nice to talk to and very accommodating. I would absolutely stay here again. Thank you!

Sheila and Alex were there to welcome U.S. and showed us where everything was. The apartment is comfortable and well equipped. Unlike other apartments in Bed Stuy the bedroom is at the back which makes it quiet.

We had a great stay at Alex and Shalia's! The apt is located in a nice neighborhood with lots of markets, coffee hops and restaurants. Prior to our stay Alex sent us a detailed email about where to go and what to do during our stay. It was so helpful and we referred back to it a lot! 

The only thing that was a minor set back was the noise. Upstairs and outside... It was super loud. Luckily, we are used to it because we live in an 100 year old apt in a busy neighborhood back home, but I could see it being an issue for someone not used to it. Shalia and Alex do provide earplugs though, so that I can imagine would be helpful. 

Other then that, Alex is very, VERY good at communication! He responded to me quickly when I asked if we could leave our bags longer on our last day! We were so happy about the flexibility of him letting us do that and quick response!

Thanks again for hosting a great experience for us! Next time we are on the east coast, we would definitely want to stay at your place again!

El departamento cumplió con todas nuestras expectativas, todo estaba   impecable, confortable, con todas las comodidades necesarias para unas buenas vacaciones. Ellos fueron muy amables con nosotros y estuvieron dispuestos ante nuestras inquietudes.
El vecindario tranquilo, seguro, hemos regresado tarde en la noche o salir a las 4 am y no hemos tenido ningún inconveniente. Esta situado cerca de la Linea A y de la J, lo que lo convierte en un lugar de acceso estratégico para poder movernos hacia el aeropuerto o hacia Manhattan.

L'appartement correspond exactement à ce qui est décrit dans l'annonce. Il est grand, propre et on s'y sent en sécurité. Le lit est très confortable, mais il y a du bruit à l'étage (nous avons compris l'utilité des boules Quies qui se trouvent sur la table de chevet). Nous n'avons rencontré qu'Alex, qui s'est montré disponible, et qui a toujours été réactif lorsque nous préparions notre voyage à New York pour répondre à nos questions. L'appartement se trouve à 10 min à pied des stations Kosciusko St et Utica Av, ce qui est très pratique pour visiter la ville. Le quartier est calme, les habitants accessibles et disponibles pour répondre à nos questions, et nous avions pris nos habitudes au Trade Union Cafe sur Malcolm X Blvd (que nous recommandons!), sur le chemin du métro.

We were disappointed with Shaila and Alex's apartment. 

When signing up they sent a great guide to the area and when we arrived the flat was clean, spacious and modern. 

However, the kitchen is above the bedroom and the back garden right beside it. Noise travels very easily in the apartment and we therefore struggled to sleep past 8/9am most mornings. 

We also had an unannounced visit despite being told notice would be given in advance if access to the basement was needed. Shaila and Alex thought we were out (but we were in bed) and came into the flat 2 seconds after knocking. No notice was given, if it had we would have been ok with it as this is what it states in the description. 

The wifi is also pretty poor. When staying you are a guest on their home network and they have obviously limited the connection. We did message them and they tried to fix it but if you are looking to stream anything it means a lot of buffering. The network also kicks you of periodically.

We really enjoyed our stay here. The place is under 10mins away from an express stop subway station which saved us time. The photos are pretty accurate. The place is spacious, comfortable and nicely decorated.

Shaila and Alex were quick to reply to emails and very helpul. We tried some of their recommended restaurants and they were amazing. We also recommend Trade Union cafe on the way to the station.

If you don't mind having to travel about half an hour into the city, this place would be great. Plus, it's really close to Williamsburg and Brooklyn Heights.

Thanks Shaila and Alex.

Shaila and Alex 's place suited our needs perfectly by providing a very clean, roomy, nicely air-conditioned spot to rest during a very busy and hot weekend in Brooklyn.  We never met the hosts in person because the arrival and departure instructions were very clear.  But we felt they were readily available and easy to contact, if needed.
We really enjoyed our stay! The hosts made us feel welcomed and were very responsive. Perfect, clean appartment.

Asunto oli sellainen kuin luvattiin, iso ja mukava. Keittiö oli iso ja hyvin varusteltu, helppo tehdä itse ruokaa. Yöllä oli rauhallista nukkua mutta aamuisin äänet kadulta ja yläkerrasta kuuluivat selvästi. Hinta-laatusuhde oli hyvä, sijainti oli hieman kaukana Manhattanista (n 50min metrolla) mutta sopi meidän tarpeisiimme hyvin.

We had a great stay at Sheila and Alex's place. Alex greeted us earlier than the check in time which was great for us! Everything was really clear and they had given us a neighbourhood guide which was extremely detailed and let us feel like locals in the area. We really appreciated this!

They were super wonderful! I didn't get a chance to meet them, but they were very responsive and very helpful! The place was beautiful and super cute! The location was close to the train and many places to eat and hangout! Next time I'm in Brooklyn know where I am staying!
Enjoyed the space and the overall experience was good!! The hosts were very helpful and nice. Will check availability on my next visit to NY.
great apartment! large and spacious. fully match the photos. A 10-minute walk from the metro Utica. excellent cuisine, you can buy food and prepare meals. I recommend!

Very nice and spacious apartment in an up-coming area in Brooklyn. Getting to and from Manhattan / Brooklyn is very easy, as it's well connected to the A/J lines, and the first Citibike stop is five Blocks away. 

Communications with Alex were very easy, always good to reach them in case needed. Can definitely recommend this for a longer stay in the new York area.
This was a great house and a great location!

Thank you Alex and Shaila, 

Your apartment is the perfect space to rest and relax. Bare bones and minimal design is refreshing in such a vibrant and bustling city. 

I will definitely look to stay here first when I next travel to the NYC area. Just the perfect spot. 

with warmth,
nelle

Après seulement quelques échanges j'ai tout de suite senti que Shaîla et Alex étaient fait pour accueillir des gens . Ils ont répondu tout de suite à ma demande et m'ont tout de suite guidée et envoyer les informations nécessaires pour préparer mon arrivée, et durant mon séjour sur place. J'ai passé un séjour très très confortable chez Shaîla et Alex . Ce sont des hôtes généreux , l'appartement est propre, joli, très agréable . Il est situé proche de plusieurs lignes de métro , ce qui facilite les déplacements. Il y a beaucoup d'épiceries autour de l'appartement et le quartier est très agréable ainsi que les voisins qu'on y (Website hidden by Airbnb) recommande vraiment cette adresse pour votre séjour à New York.
The apartment was great and I loved the neighbourhood, lots of good restaurants and cafes nearby. Shaila and Alex were awesome hosts and communication was smooth. Thanks for everything!

The flat was clean and the communication was great from the hosts. I would recommend if you wanted somewhere to just sleep. Area was good ( I recommend taxis as it is rough around the edges) great stay the only thing I would say is in the  flat is freezing and only little heaters to keep warm. Also the noise from upstairs was very loud to the point you could hear full conversations. I really loved my stay however my friend did leave early due to being ill with the cold. Great wee find in the city of Brooklyn

We were really lucky to find Shaila & Alex's place available. It was a lovely apartment, plenty of room and had everything we needed. Great to have such a large fridge and oven so we could make breakfast. The shower is powerful and hot, the bed big and comfy - perfect. It did get chilly so Alex had kindly left us 2 heaters, which was great. 

The location is brilliant. We were there during election time so went to a local bar to commiserate and watch the results unfold, highly recommend Peaches for late night drinks and a comfy sofa. We also LOVED Saraghina for delicious Italian (not the cheapest but soooo good) and great coffee/pastries can be found at George-Andres Vintage cafe. All 3 of these are a 10min walk from the apartment. 

Would stay here again!

I really liked this place! Very cute and cozy, a lot of room to lounge around. Very clean, the kitchen is a good size, bed and couch is comfy. Hosts are very kind, hospitable, anything that we needed, they provided immediately for us. Thank you for being so helpful!
Un lugar confortable para dos personas con todo lo necesario para pasarlo bien. Hubo algún problema de comunicación pero se solucionó rápidamente.

Alex and Shaila's place is a nice, clean, friendly, and adequately furnished place to stay. Bus and rail nearby is a real plus. Do try the brunch at L'Antagoniste if you get a chance ! Yummy and not terribly expensive. ( don't EVEN slow down for Crown Fried Chicken, though ! just keep on walking ! ) Noise from the apartment overhead is a problem ( early in the morning ! ) and we encountered a couple of characters on the street that gave us pause, though, only pause. Other than that; nice place, nice folks, fair price. Do it.

Love Brooklyn and Bed Stuy.  
Apartment was cheap in price.  But uncomfortable.  I wish I had paid for more comfort.
Kitchen not well equipped.  No coffee filters or paper towels for example.
Freezer full of food?  Trash in cabinets.  Dishwasher full of dishes when we arrived.
Bed was not very comfortable.  Pillows were painfully flat.  Like sacks of grain.  Actually rolled up blankets and stuffed into pillow cases to sleep.  Lots of towels were appreciated.  We only used 4 but there were a dozen or more.

But worst... The noise from the owners above was excessive.  Little feet early in the morning but that I could excuse... We were anxious to get up and at the city in the morning.  But the noise at night was bad... One night it lasted til after 1:30.  Terrible noises
Super cute. I'd definitely book this place again.

We had a wonderful stay in this apartment! The bed was very comfortable. The apartment was actually bigger than we'd expected from the photos. It was the easiest check in ever. It was immaculately clean has a very comfy sofa. We really loved the area. We thought it was a great price too. Highly recommended.
Everything in the house fantastic thank you
Shaila & Alex's home was exactly how it was listed, no surprises. Loved the neighborhood. I would recommend this space for the traveler looking to experience the real Brooklyn.

We had a great stay in Shaila & Alex's place, the apartment matches perfectly the description. The whole place was clean, well-appointed, and some new extra products were available. They have been very welcoming, and made sure that we felt comfortable. 
Well located between 2 subway stations, so it's pretty easy to go to Manhattan, or to move elsewhere in Brooklyn. 
Good tuck shop and grocer's shop very close too, and great restaurants too (Peaches was amazing!).
If you are looking for a place to spend a week visiting NYC, do not hesitate, here is your place.

There were a few options on our radar when we booked our trip for NYC but we made a great choice with Shaila and Alex! The house was easy to find and we were lucky to get parking right in front. Word to the wise, the street does have scheduled times for street cleaning during the week but there are plenty of signs. We emailed Shaila and Alex with questions about parking as well, just to be sure, and they were very prompt with a response. The private entrance is nice and really makes you feel like you're in your own home. Check in was extremely easy. We didn't have much face to face contact until the last day but we'll get to that.

Anyway, we were pleasantly surprised by the space. We were offered a nice couch, a spacious kitchen area with a fridge for our many leftovers, a bedroom with a comfortable bed and lots of pillows, and a bathroom with a functioning and clean shower. The only thing we wanted for was a tv but we figured we were on vacation so it was like a blessing in disguise. The decor was nice and the place was warm and clean. The neighborhood was about how you would expect it. Nice and affordable places to eat and a lovely coffee shop nearby that made the most delicious Nutella lattes. Peaches offers amazing fried chicken, the pizza (BKLYN I think it was called) was shockingly great and arrived quickly. Access to the subway was about a 10 minute walk so nothing too extreme. 

On our last day, however, Stella decided she was going to dump snow all over the city. We were in a rush to get the car packed and head out before the city went into total lockdown mode and accidentally locked ourselves out of the apartment. Another piece of advice, the door locks behind you automatically. I'm sure we could've fixed that but for security purposes, it seemed like a smart decision on Alex and Shaila's part. What could've ended terribly was a very easy fix. Maybe it was because they were snowed in but both offered assistance and we were out on the road in no time! They were even kind enough to warn us the day before (via email) that we were going to get hit with a snow storm and expressed concern that we were planning to drive through it. Nice people, great place, just remember that a family lives upstairs so try to keep the noise down (they never said anything about noise but just as a courtesy). Thanks!!!

A very nice apartment with a 10 min walk to the train station an some nice restaurants around. We had been to NYC for the first time and really enjoyed it! For any questions Alex & Shaila were available at anytime.

this place was amazing because my partner and i are vegan and soo many place popped up when looking for places to eat. the metro wasnt a far walk and the corner stores have everything you need. this place was cozy and looks great! though we didnt spend to much inside, the place was awesome! shaila and alex were great hosta and always checking up if you need anything!
La casa está excelente y muy cómoda. Un buen lugar para quedarse. La ubicación un poco alejada del manhattan y el centro de brooklyn.  El resto fantástico

Shaila and Alex's apartment is the perfect place if you want to enjoy Brooklyn, furthermore subway stations are very close and you can reach Manhattan in no more than 30 minutes. We fell in love with the neighborhood... I don't want to say anything more as you have to discover it! The apartment is spacious and well equipped, the living room and the bedroom are even bigger than you can imagine from the pictures. We only had some problems with the check-in as the hosts forgot about our arrival but they sorted out immediately and made sure that we felt comfortable.
Great vibe to this place, well maintained and no joke loved the lack of a television.  I want to live here.

Shaila and Alex's place was perfect. It was clean, had everything you needed while away. They included a little guide with restaurants and other shops and stores which was very helpful. They were readily available if I ever needed anything. A great place and great hosts. I hope to see them again soon.
Excelentes anfitriones, Comunicación inmediata y privacidad, magnificas recomendaciones del vecindario

Very nice flat in Brooklyn Bed- Stu.
We enjoyed our trip to NY.
Alex and Shaila were very helpful

Me hospedé con mi novia por 8 noches y la verdad que estuvo
genial . Está cerca de la estación de subtes que te llevan a Manhattan , es recomendable ir en el expreso. El Barrio durante la semana es tranquilo los fines puede ser un poco ruidosos por el vecindario. Alex estuvo siempre a disposición y fue muy amable con nosotros . El departamento es muy lindo , tiene todos los elementos de cocina necesarios . Volvería a ir !

Our stay at Alex & Shaila was great. The appartment is very nice and clean. They were very helpfull about all the cool stuff and places around the flat. The only thing is that the neighbourhood is not that quiet. Cars parked in the streets with music till late in night. But except that, it's a great place.

Shaila and Alex's place was good and true to the ad. We enjoyed our stay. Some downfalls were the upstairs noise and the outside rowdiness, but we were given ear plugs, which was a nice thought. The neighborhood can be questionable at night, although no one bothered us, we were very cautious walking about. Not sure if it was us or the machine, but not until our last night, the AC wouldn't cool down below 74. This sounds cool, but on a day where it reached 90, we woke up sweating. The location is close to public transportation and little cafes. About a 40 minutes ride to time square and 30 minutes to Williamsburg area. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were the softest I've ever felt! Would recommend.
Exactly as pictured and described. The apartment was clean and cozy, and close to public transport. The neighborhood is full of great restaurants. I would definitely stay here again!

Nice clean apartment, plenty of space and all the amenities needed. Location was good between a few different subway stops for good coverage. The communication was perfect. Shaila & Alex on hand when needed. Fully recommended.
Bon logement très bien situé

Brooklyn easily became one of my new favorite places on this trip, Shaila and Alex were great hosts, and were accepting of our super late check in due to flight delays getting in, and were great communicators, even greeted us when we got dropped off.

The suite is a short walk to the nearest train station which got us easily to Yankee Stadium and back without incident. Lots of good food in the neighborhood and lots of craft coffee choices. (Trade Union Coffee is AMAZING). 

I will stay here again!

Shaila and Alex are great hosts, communicative and friendly. The apartment was exactly as described and we enjoyed our stay. Short commute to Williamsburg or Manhattan. We highly appreciated all the great advice for restaurants etc. in the area. The neighborhood was a bit more questionable than we expected. The street is very dirty and there was loud music, neighbors fighting and screaming at all hours of the day. The apartment is also not very well sound isolated and you can hear absolutely everything from the apartment above. Air condition was also very loud so you can't use it at night. This is not the place for you if you want to sleep in and are looking for a quiet place, but for us it was perfectly fine.

The apartment is in a friendly and calm area, 15 mn distance from subway to manhattan center. The apartment is in perfect conditions with a full equipped kitchen and really nice shower. Supermarket really near open every day. Shaila and Alex made us a perfect guide for the neighborhood with all the details needed. It was a very pleasant stay. Highly recommended.

Shaila and Alex's place was so perfect for our nearly week-long stay in New York. Communication was excellent, they provided everything we needed for the stay, and they even offered up so many great tips and local spots that we definitely made use of. We love Bed Stuy and their place was affordable and comfortable. Thanks so much, Shaila and Alex! We'd definitely come back!

I would definitely recommend staying at Shaila & Alex’s place, especially if you’re looking for a stylishly simple and Inexpensive stay. The area is right in Brooklyn, surrounded by trees and livelihood. They allowed us to check in early which was awesome and we were also provided an entire list on the countless things that could be done around the city. Upon returning to New York, Shaila & Alex’s place will be one of the first on my list.

Great hosts, great roomy apartment! Excellent neighborhood tips, hosts respond very quickly. 

Apartment was very cozy. Easy to get car service and 10 min walk to train lines in either direction.

Shaila and Alex's place is comfortable and affordable. We loved the location - it's an easy walk to a couple different subway stations, and there are some great dining options nearby. Also loved having a full kitchen; though we didn't cook a full meal, it was great to be able to make coffee and heat up leftovers when we wanted to. Would definitely stay there again!
Nice, spacious place. Very clean and everything I needed. Shaila & Alex are quick to respond and very helpful. Enjoyed the helpful instructions they left for me.

Shaila & Alex’s Bed-Stuy garden apartment is the perfect home away from home. Was pleasantly surprised that the space was actually larger than it looks in photos! I accidentally mixed up my check out time and Alex was very kind and super patient as we sorted it out.
The house is a sweet, cozy and clean. Shaila is very kind. So happy to stay here will book it again if come to New York next time.
Great place, clean, stocked, large, close to Metro, gave my wife and I, a true New York experience, at a great price

Check in/out was a breeze. We arrived to NY on a snowy day, and the place was clean and warm.  The bed was comfortable and the blankets were warm. The place is about 10 min away from two train stops, so it was easy to navigate the city.

We stayed here between Christmas and New Year. ♫ The weather outside was frightful ♫ but Shaila and Alex's downstairs apartment was a nice little retreat. We ordered in regularly from a great selection of places. We didn't get the chance to meet Shaila and Alex but they were attentive to our messages and showed kindness and understanding. The apartment was nice and comfortable. There is a little bit of a walk to get to the train stations to get to Manhattan but even in the cold, ten minutes wassn't too troublesome. There was also a bit of confusion about the colours of the keys described to us but once that was figured out we had no problems.

Thanks Shaila and Alex.
Best neighborhood!!
Great affordable spot with very easy check in/out!
This place is a real treat. Convenient, comfortable, stylish and spacious. A wonderful experience in the heart of Bed-Stuy.

Great little place for a quick NYC getaway. Easy to get to the train, and there are more restaurants within walking distance of the apartment than you could visit in a week. Shaila and Alex were great, respectful hosts. We hope we can stay here again someday!

Shaila & Alex have the BEST place and value in New York. I searched for weeks for a place like this, and couldn’t find any for a better price. Check in was smooth, and everything was just like the photos. I will definitely stay here again if I ever visit New York again!
Shaila & Alex's apartment was clean, quiet and out of the way. They were very helpful with things to do in the area and very communicative.

What a spot! Everything is so clean and neat. The spot is incredibly big for New York. Check-in was very simple, as soon as I found the home. The bed is heavenly and the showerhead is the appropriate height especially if you’re over 6 ft it helps. Clean towels, hairdryer, even razors and shaving cream had I needed it. Beautifully decorated with art and nice furniture and there was no trouble getting transportation service.

The host was greatand attentive and house was clean and really close to A/C train line which was really comfortable. But also it was really noisy  every night we were woken up by someone walking upstairs every night afrer 1:30 Am and was really uncomfortable and also woken up every morning by noise from upstairs . But over it is good place.

Place was accurate to pictures shown. We had a huge space to ourselves with adequate heating in all rooms, as well as a well-stocked kitchen. 

Those who prefer firm mattresses should note that the mattress was on a softer side.

Comfy bed and roomy. Located near our son's apartment in Bed-Stuy so super convenient for us. Walkable to the J/Z/M and A/C subway lines for easy access to the city and JFK. A number of decent neighborhood eateries within a few blocks.

Superstützpunkt für einen N.Y. Aufenthalt: sehr nette Nachbarschaft, die wir uns durch die umfassenden Tipps von Shaila und Alex (Einkaufsmöglichkeiten, Restaurants, Musiklokale, Taxiservice und Fahrradverleih) erschließen konnten, wodurch wir mit die schönsten Erlebnisse auf der Reise hatten. Manhattan ist durch die Subway schnell zu erreichen und in Brooklyn kann man sich dann wieder von den Touristenhorden erholen. Die Wohnung ist angenehm und praktisch und sogar Grundnahrungsmittel waren da. Die Gastgeber haben wir nicht persönlich getroffen, sie waren per Email aber immer ansprechbar.
good and Affordable place to stay
Large & quiet 1 bedroom with fast WiFi

We had a great time in NYC and the apartment was really nice. Great restaurant recos especially Trade Union Cafe and Grandchamps! The distance to metro (bus is with metrocard for free to get to the metro) and Manhattan is absolutely ok. The apartment is clean and well-equipped! Unfortunately as any house in the US it is not that soundproofed. So when the family gets up in the morning you need to get earplugs (which are provided). 
Thank you Shaila&Alex for hosting us!
Excellent experience! Shalia and Alex's place was perfect!

Had a great time in Brooklyn. It was easy to access transit from there place and they were super accommodating to our early check in/check out requests. Bed was super comfortable. If we had any questions, they got back to us right away. Would stay here again if heading back to New York.
God beliggenhed, alt fungerer, venlige og servicemindede værter.
Great stay!  Clean, spacious.  About a half mile from the A-train and lots of dining options nearby.

Shaila and Alex's are amazing hosts! They are kind and accomodating.
Their place looks exactly like the pics, clean and close to the subway station.
It is a nice neighbourhood with tons of places to eat near by.
I would definitely stay here again.

This couple was absolutely amazing! From the moment I booked the apartment they were nothing but helpful and informative. The apartment was exactly what the description and pictures portrayed! I would without a doubt stay here again and again....and again!
Awesome apartment to stay at!
Alex and Shaila’s place was great! It was very clean, artfully decorated, well- equipped, quiet and very comfortable in every way! Highly recommended. The neighbourhood is cool too.

Shaila and Alex's place was exactly as it looks in the pictures - spacious, simple, but very stylish and comfy. They were very helpful with tips and suggestions, which was great because I was new to NYC! I would definitely stay with Shaila and Alex again if in the area.

I would stay here again. I met shaila and Alex the first night I got in as I was leaving with friends and they were so nice. The space is clean and big and super cute! I had trouble getting in late one night with the keys and Alex came down within minutes to let me in.
This place is huge and located in a great neighbourhood. The house guide was full of great recommendations for food and we had everything we needed! We’d happily stay here again. Thank you!

Appartement et hôtes très agréables. Conforme a la description dans Airbnb.
Quartier atypique a 15 minutes de la ligne A du métro pour Manhattan et accès facile depuis JFK.
We loved our stay! Sheila & Alex were very friendly and the apartment was beautiful!
Great guests !! Will comeback

We spent a great few days in Shaila and Alex's apartment. It's a great space and larger than the pictures would make you think. Very easy check in and out, good coffee nearby and an easy walk to the subway for a direct link to downtown. Would highly recommend!

A friend and I met in NYC for a girls’ trip and decided that, to save money, we would stay in Brooklyn instead of Manhattan. We were a little nervous about how it would be with the daily travel into the city and how safe it would be. It turned out to be the best decision for us. We needed up falling in love with the area and got to see a side of NYC living that we would have missed if we had stayed in the city. Alex was so great- he answered all our questions and gave us great recommendations for places to eat (please don’t miss Saraghina- their pizza was the best we’ve ever had). We even got to be there for a neighborhood block party which was really fun to see. The trip into the city was not bad at all. They house is near a subway station. The only downside was that on the weekends the subway stops change and we had to take a Lyft home on those nights (we couldn’t figure out the changed schedule). We would definitely stay here again.

We had a great stay. Shaila and Alex’s local tips and tricks were fab, we went to most places on the list and were really pleased with all of them, especially Saraghina... we went twice! Shaila and Alex always responds def quickly to any questions. The place was spacious, clean and plenty big enough for two. It also had natural daylight with is always important in the city. Transport links are a short walk away, with an express train running  regularly to Manhattan. This was my first time in NYC and I loved getting to know part of Brooklyn as well as touring Manhatten’s sights. Would definitely stay again.
Great place with great local tips on what to eat and drink. Would stay again and recommend to others who want to explore NYC.

We had a great stay at Shaila&Alex' apartment! They answered all our questions very fast and gave great and helpful tips for the neighbourhood. The apartment is very big, very clean and there was everything one would need in the kitchen, bathroom, bedroom... (e.g. towels, soap, dishes etc.).
The subway is only 5-10 minutes away and you can reach Manhattan quickly. But we also really enjoyed staying in Brooklyn and getting to know this cool neighbourhood.
We would definitely stay here again!

This location is in each point perfect. Position is in a quite place in Brooklyn, outside chaos in Manhattan, people in that place is very nice. there're more tube station near house, confortable for move in the city center. Sheila & Alex are very fast to answer me for everything. House is clean and very roomy and there's all necessary to leave it. I'm happy to my choice.

Very nice place in a cool neighborhood in Brooklyn. Shauna and Alex give great neighborhood information and are extremely responsive. 
We loved it.
Stayed for 4 days. Down comforter on the bed sooo comfy!
Such a great place to stay. Spacious, clean and in a great area. Would stay again and would highly recommend.
Příjemný  a nerušený pobyt v docela hezkém bytě a milém prostředí Brooklynu.
Bonito departamento con mucho estilo, gran ubicación, cerca de una estación del tren

Shaila and Alex’s place was much bigger than my sister and I had expected.  It was the perfect, warm and cozy home to come back to after exploring the city in late November.  There are a ton of good restaurants nearby and the subway is a short 12-ish minute walk away.  Brooklyn ended up being our favorite part of our vacation so it was awesome to be near Dumbo/Brooklyn Bridge Area (instead of staying in Manhattan).  Great value and super communicative hosts!  Would totally stay with them again :)

My boyfriend and I stayed at Shaila & Alex’s apartment for a few nights. It looked exactly like the photos! It was clean, tidy and comfortable to stay in. We enjoyed checking out a couple local spots Shaila & Alex recommended. Check-in was quick and easy. We’d love to visit again.
Everything was perfect, little bit far from Manhattan, but you can take the metro a few blocks walking. Lots of restaurants and grocery nearby. Shaila and Alex were very kind.

We loved staying at Shaila and Alex’s place! The location is really cool and with the comprehensive local guide provided by Shaila and Alex, we were able to check out cool bars, cafes and restaurants. The location is a close walk to a subway station that you can take to Manhattan. We really enjoyed exploring Brooklyn as well. The space is lovely and the bed was so comfortable - the perfect place to relax after a long day of sightseeing. Highly recommend and we hope to return one day :)

Shaila and Alex’s place was just as expected! It was clean and very spacious. It is in a good neighborhood and it seemed to be safe, we didn’t have any issues. 
As stated by other guests, the noise was the only issue we encountered. You can hear upstairs tenants walking around early in the morning and late at night.
Lovely stay & very convenient!

Very clean, nice apartment in the Bed- Stuy neighborhood. The hosts gave a super helpful guide to the neighborhood which we referenced often! Less than 15 min walk to the subway. We truly enjoyed our stay!

Lovely, stylish apartment. Everything was clean and in great condition. Check in was easy and quick. Great location, very easy to get in and out of Manhattan via the subway. Some cute places in the neighbourhood to eat, go for a drink or have coffee.

We choose this location as we felt it was good value for a complete apartment and a daily commute to and from the Javits Centre in Manhattan. Good transport links and the right side of JFK airport. Plenty of good facilities in the local area.

What a great apartment! Cute and VERY spacious for the city. A bit of a walk to the trains. The closest line is about a 12 minute walk. The only major inconvenience is the noise from the apartment above. You can hear EVERYTHING, which is really only a problem in the morning. Otherwise, it’s a great place to stay for a great value!

Superbe appartement, vraiment conforme à la description et aux photos. La localisation est parfaite. Quartier calme et sécurisé très accessible en transport en commun et à toutes heures. Proche de toutes commodités. Vraiment un excellent choix que nous recommandons.

name: Feel like home
summary: Comfortable studio apartment in the heart of downtown...  3 minutes walk to place des artes (metro station,Jazz festival,just for laughs festival,...)yet very quiet! very clean building. Everything u need is included!!Tv,fast internet;all possible stores in a few minutes walk.
space: The vibe!  lovely balcony+ Quick access to anything and anywhere...3 minutes to Jazz festival,francophone festival&...Metro station and bus stops.you can walk to Mcgill and old port as well!!! 3 minutes walk to Saint Laurant street and Mural festival.
description: Comfortable studio apartment in the heart of downtown...  3 minutes walk to place des artes (metro station,Jazz festival,just for laughs festival,...)yet very quiet! very clean building. Everything u need is included!!Tv,fast internet;all possible stores in a few minutes walk. The vibe!  lovely balcony+ Quick access to anything and anywhere...3 minutes to Jazz festival,francophone festival&...Metro station and bus stops.you can walk to Mcgill and old port as well!!! 3 minutes walk to Saint Laurant street and Mural festival. Metro station.bus stops,Bixi,liquor store,Provigo,Metro And ... Starbucks ,second cup ,Tim horton... As long as you need me. It's the best cause it's close to whatever you might need and love... Jazz festival,just for laughs, formula 1,downtown are just here,3 minutes walk away!!! Bus,metro,bixi in 2 minutes! Balcony! There is a lovely balcony you can enjoy as well...perfect for summer time!nice view as well...
neighborhood_overview: It's the best cause it's close to whatever you might need and love... Jazz festival,just for laughs, formula 1,downtown are just here,3 minutes walk away!!!
notes: Balcony! There is a lovely balcony you can enjoy as well...perfect for summer time!nice view as well...
transit: Bus,metro,bixi in 2 minutes!
access: Metro station.bus stops,Bixi,liquor store,Provigo,Metro And ... Starbucks ,second cup ,Tim horton...
interaction: As long as you need me.
house_rules: Enjoy as much as you can! No parties or friends over... If you lose the key u need to pay 25$( building's rule)... If you break something there is relevant charges. Smoking only allowed in the balcony,sorry but not that bad:)

reviews.comments: I had a lovely stay in Montreal. Titi's studio is cute, clean, cosy and warm. It is right by Place des Arts' tube station and it is close to a supermarket, shops, cafes, etc. The bus going to and from the airport stops just down the road, it is a 10 minutes straight walk. Titi was prompt to reply to my queries when booking the place and also remained available throughout my stay. Titi had left some space in the drawers so I could unpack and I had the fridge to put my week's supplies. It felt very homely. Wifi also worked very well. I will happily book  Titi's place again should I go back to Montreal.

Our host was excellent and very accommodating.  She and a friend met us to let us in and give us the keys fairly late which was very much appreciated. The location is awesome, the decor super cute. Everything you need is here! Towels, wifi password, everything was easily accessible. Thanks so much! We will stay here again for sure.

I had a great time in Montreal and it was compounded by this awesome corner unit apartment that was conveniently close to a lot of the main hubs of Montreal. It's 2 blocks away from the Metro and less than a mile walking distance from most places as well.  The apartment overall was very cozy, well heated during my winter stay and neighbors are very quiet. Would definitely recommend.

Excellent accueil, Titi est très arrangeant. Je me suis réellement sentie à la maison. Je recommande ! Et location excellente, plein de bons restaurants à proximité, on peut tout faire à pied, très proche du centre ville. In love !!!

Our experience was great. The apartment is small but very cozy and located in a great area. There were so many great places to grab a drink, eat, and even shop. Without a doubt, I would stay here again.
Titi was very welcoming and so incredibly helpful during my stay. Loved the place and location. I Would definitely stay there again.

Titi's apartment was just perfect for our weekend trip to Montreal! The location was fabulous, with amazing restaurants and 2 natural food stores within blocks, and downtown right there. Titi was so helpful! We needed to switch places, and with less than 24 hours notice she made it work for us to stay there. She was friendly and welcoming, and was timely with responses to our questions. Her place was inviting, bright and cozy. Everything was clean, parking tended to be pretty easy (although confusing in Montreal!), and the kitchen was stocked enough for us to cook up quick meals. The bed was a full sized futon-like bed, which was comfy yet pretty firm. Overall, a great place to stay! We will definitely be back. Thank you Titi!

The location is just perfect - in the center of EVERYTHING! The apartment is very cosy, charmingly decorated, and has a little balcony looking out to a beautiful street. Titi is very nice, responsive and helpful. Thank you so much Titi, I had a wonderful stay and would love to go back :)
Titi's apartment makes for a very genuine Airbnb experience. It was very nice to get to spend a couple of days in her environment. :)
Hôte sympathique et bel appartement, très bien situé.

Titi was extremely nice, her apartment is beautiful! It is small, but perfect for a city trip, we walked to all major city attractions (about a 30 min walk to old Montreal) and it's a nice neighborhood. Titi was very approachable to us!

We loved staying at Titi's. She was very understanding about us arriving later than expected, and when we did arrive she even came out to help us find a parking spot. Her apartment is clean, beautifully decorated, and has everything you need for an enjoyable stay. The location of the neighborhood is perfect. It is quaint and residential but very close to everything you need. Just a few short blocks to the metro gives you acces to the full city. Also within walking distance is the park and shopping streets like Saint Laurant. Titi was available for anything that we needed, and always responded promptly. Thank you, Titi, for the wonderful hospitality! We would love to stay again in the future.
Wonderful location and comfortable place for our visit to Montreal! So easy to walk wherever you need to go from this place. Great balcony and relaxing apartment. Highly recommend!

The experience was very comfortable and Titi's little apartment is cozy with bright, welcoming colours. The place is basically a 5 minute walk from downtown, and parking was not too difficult to find either. We had access to wifi and the tv monitor which I easily connected to my computer with an HDMI. Titi was always there, a call away, if we had any questions. Although we weren't able to see her during check-in because we arrived quite late in the evening, she had turned on the AC and a fan so that we would have a cool room in the heat of the summer. Also, there's a lovely balcony which is a nice addition if you're visiting during the spring or summer.
Had a great visit in Montreal. Titi's place was clean, comfortable, and was in a great location. Meeting up to get the key was easy. I'd recommend her place for sure.

Had no problems checking in or checking out, Titi was around and fast at responding to any questions. The apartment was in a great location within walking distance to most of the places we wanted to go. The room was comfortable and neat/tidy. Wifi was fast.

Thanks again!
Nice location, good apartment.

Titi was a fantastic host! She was kind, helpful and very friendly. We loved the decor of this apartment, and especially enjoyed the little balcony. The location however was UNBEATABLE. Very close to Mount Royal Park, Parc avenue, St. Laurent Street and a close Bixi bike ride to Old Montreal and Jean Talon Market. We had a fantastic stay and would absolutely come back and stay at Titi's place again, 5-stars!

My girlfriend and I had a fantastic stay at Titi's apartment. It was in a perfect location, close walking distance to almost all the wonderful parts of Montreal. She was extremely hospitable when it came to us bringing along our dog too which made the trip so much easier for us. The apartment itself was very clean and comfortable. Would highly recommend it to anyone heading to Montreal!

Great location. Walking distance to many of the sights in Montreal. Also a very short walk to a metro station. Restaurants, cafés, and grocery stores nearby as well. Overall, enjoyed my stay at the apartment.
Me and my friend stayed there for the New Year's Eve. We had a great time and were able to walk to the old port. Titi was very nice and helpful and the place was really clean and cozy :)

Titi's place is a wonderful option for anyone looking to stay in the heart of Montréal at an affordable price. Her place is small, but quaint and clean and has everything you need as a solo traveler (would be good for couples too). Her apartment is only about 5 minutes walk to Place des Arts metro, which makes getting around the city super easy. Also, the fact that her place has an air conditioning unit is a nice plus during the hot summer months. Beyond that, communication with Titi was very timely and she was even nice enough to invite me to go out downtown with her and her friends on my first night there (though I ultimately wasn't able to due to other plans). Would definitely recommend this place and stay again in the future!
Titi's place is located in a very convenient and safe location.
Titi was a very sympatetic, friendly and helpful host. Her apartement is in a perfect location and the balcony with great view is wonderful.
Place was clean and close to everything. Great location!

Tina was incredibly flexible and helpful throughout our planning and check-in. We arrived very late and Tina made sure to communicate and arrange everything for us. The location is unbeatable and the balcony was wonderful to relax on after a long day. 

We were close to the metro, lots of restaurants, a grocery store and everything you might need. 

The one thing we were not accustomed to, and this may be normal in Montreal, is the extreme firmness of the mattress. For those who are used to sleeping on softer mattresses, be aware this will not be your experience. 

We had a lovely time and were happy to stay at Tina's!
Great location and cute apartment. Would have loved to stay longer, actually!

Superb location ! Walking distance of a 24hrs coffee shop... Grocery store and so many late night restaurants....Not to mention - it’s near a metro
Cosy and honestly felt like home - Cute and colourful home.
Titi's place is very central, we could walk or bike to anywhere. Titi responded quickly to all my questions. Full kitchen available but the bathroom need a bit more upkeep.

This space was exactly what I was looking for. Great for two people! The balcony was a great addition to a stylish space. The host made everything a breeze and was very quick  to respond. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Titi’s cute little space was perfect for me - walking distance to the Jazz Festival & super easy to get around in a lovely neighbourhood. She was very calm, quick & responsive to my texts when I got lost & confused upon arrival ! I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to  Montreal.
Great apartment and great location.  Thanks for a wonderful stay!
Great communication, cozy place and perfect location. The bed needs to improve but overall was a great experience. I recommend the place, Titi is great.

très bel appartement, lit confortable et deco soignée.
bien situé et bien desservi
L'appartement est très fonctionnel et proche de beaucoup de lieux  à visiter!
While the location of this accommodation was ideal, with the shortcomings with the Wifi and kitchen resulted in this being a very poor value
Great location!
great location and wonderful balcony.

L’appartement de Titi est idéalement placé à 2 pas de la place des arts permettant de profiter de Montréal très facilement à pied ou via le métro. 
Le studio est agréable à vivre pour 2 personnes, l’accueil s’est très bien passé grâce aux échanges avec Titi.
Nous recommandons vivement ce logement !
Merci Titi de nous avoir accueillis !

é um espaço simples, cheio de móveis, travesseiros muito ruins, poucos talheres. No entanto, está numa ótima localização, assim, se não for muito exigente, dá para aceitar o prédio velho, o apartamento com roupas da dona e atopetado de móveis. A hospedeira foi simpática.

Our stay was just GREAT! Titi is a perfect host, she answered quickly to any questions we had, gave us great suggestions and made us feel at home! The house is in a very quiet neibourhood, 2 min from a supermarket and 20 min on foot from the city center!

Very central location, close to good restaurants (I would recommend eating at Areperas and Kantapia). Very smooth communication. The kitchen equipment is quite minimal but sufficient for a short stay.

name: Bright, sunny quite room Bushwick
summary: A bright, sunny quite room in the heart of bushwick/ridgewood border.  7 min walk form the Jefferson L train which brings you directly into the Manhattan in about 20 min including 14th St Union Square stop.
space: Sunlight bedroom with queen size bed facing quite backyard. Fully equipped eat in sunlight kitchen, comfy living room and clean, well kept bathroom. Located right by heart of bushwick, 5-10 min walk to excellent restaurants, cafes bar and L train
description: A bright, sunny quite room in the heart of bushwick/ridgewood border.  7 min walk form the Jefferson L train which brings you directly into the Manhattan in about 20 min including 14th St Union Square stop. Sunlight bedroom with queen size bed facing quite backyard. Fully equipped eat in sunlight kitchen, comfy living room and clean, well kept bathroom. Located right by heart of bushwick, 5-10 min walk to excellent restaurants, cafes bar and L train full Kitchen, bathroom, living room We can let you know great spots around the neighborhood to eat and drink and recommend things to do in the city too! We've lived here for 5 years so know a thing or two about local spots and attractions. Our neighborhood is in the heart of bustling, hip bushwick with great restaurants and bars as well as cafes, art studios, yoga studios and near a park with a farmers market. A great place to and get into the city with ease 7 min walk to Jefferson L train, can't be beat! We are two sisters living in a 2 be
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is in the heart of bustling, hip bushwick with great restaurants and bars as well as cafes, art studios, yoga studios and near a park with a farmers market. A great place to and get into the city with ease
notes: We are two sisters living in a 2 bedroom apartment with room at opposite ends. I travel a lot and so rent my room out. My sister is there 1/2 the week and the other half at her boyfriends. We live on the historic Onderdonk property which has a lot of charm. We can give plenty of fun and local recommendations on where to eat and what to do in our neighborhood. Its a great place to stay and experience true Brooklyn living :)
transit: 7 min walk to Jefferson L train, can't be beat!
access: full Kitchen, bathroom, living room
interaction: We can let you know great spots around the neighborhood to eat and drink and recommend things to do in the city too! We've lived here for 5 years so know a thing or two about local spots and attractions.
house_rules: respectful of our neighbors and our space

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: young responsible adult

reviews.comments:
had a wonderfull airbnb experience stayin at louise place, she wasn't there but her sister eleanor is absolutely nice! it's a quiet house with a real room! louise is sharing her own room and it was the best bed i ever slept in through airbnb!! 
you really feel at home and eleanor let you all the privacy you need! the place is 5mn walk from the train bar & pubs and there's a deli and a laundry 1bloc away the neighborhood is quiet and you have an amazing view on manhattan's skyscrappers!
will definetely recommand this place and will be back there, if needed! 
thanks!

Elle, Louise's sister who rented out the room, was more than accommodating during my stay!

The apartment was beautiful and I wish I could stay there forever. The room is in the back and extremely bright and sunny as well as quiet and private.

name: Bright, Modern, Spacious Duplex Apt
summary: We recently updated this listing from a room to the full apartment! That means more privacy for our guests, and an even better experience. Please ask about the changes if you have questions! Astoria is 15 minutes from midtown via subway (N and Q lines near the 30th ave stop). Relax on the couch, enjoy the queen-sized bed, or do some work in the sunlight dinning room. There's no better place to rest up and recharge during your stay in NYC.
space: This used to be a private room, but we've upgraded it to a whole apt! Beautiful decor, custom built furniture, and tons of space make the apartment an incredible place to stay. You'll have the lower level bedroom and the upstairs living room and kitchen. Having one and a half baths is great for larger groups as well.
description: We recently updated this listing from a room to the full apartment! That means more privacy for our guests, and an even better experience. Please ask about the changes if you have questions! Astoria is 15 minutes from midtown via subway (N and Q lines near the 30th ave stop). Relax on the couch, enjoy the queen-sized bed, or do some work in the sunlight dinning room. There's no better place to rest up and recharge during your stay in NYC. This used to be a private room, but we've upgraded it to a whole apt! Beautiful decor, custom built furniture, and tons of space make the apartment an incredible place to stay. You'll have the lower level bedroom and the upstairs living room and kitchen. Having one and a half baths is great for larger groups as well. You'll have the lower level bedroom and half bath, upstairs you'll have a living room kitchen and bathroom. Once again, the listing is for the whole apartment, and we're happy to have it you! Think of me as your concierge. I'll answer any
neighborhood_overview: We have a 24 hour fruit stand, great supermarkets, and world-class restaurants. The neighborhood is family friendly and safe. Living here has been great for me and my family and I can't wait for you to experience the magic of Astoria. Be sure to set aside some nights to eat out locally!
transit: We're just a block away from 30th ave, and Astoria Blvd. Both stops on the N Q line. The N and Q go from Astoria to Manhattan and Brooklyn. We're also close to the express bus that goes to LaGuardia airport and Harlem (both just 10 minutes away!). There's parking on the street, but read the signs we have alternate side parking.
access: You'll have the lower level bedroom and half bath, upstairs you'll have a living room kitchen and bathroom. Once again, the listing is for the whole apartment, and we're happy to have it you!
interaction: Think of me as your concierge. I'll answer any questions you have about the area during your trip. Ask me any time! I'll do my best to help.
house_rules: Please remove your shoes when you're in the apartment. There's a nice shoe rack right by the door. Please wash your dishes after you use them. At the end of your stay, please shut all lights and close windows when leaving the apartment. You may leave the keys on the dining room table. Thank you so much for your help.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: Hey there! I'm Gabe, a software development manager from NYC. I work in life insurance and love all things digital, I'm an Airbnb host because I enjoy sharing with people!

reviews.comments:
I had the pleasure of being  Gabriel's first Airbnb customer. With that said I do not think it would matter if you were the first or the 61st, Gabriel and his Mother, Mirta made ever effort to make the stay an absolute pleasure. The space is private,quiet and very comfortable, with a separate private entrance.  The location is close to many good restaurants and the train. You have easy access to the city (train) as well as walking distance to all of Astoria. 
I would  highly recommend this site for 1 or two people. 
Jerry

There are no words to describe accurately the experience I had staying with Gabriel and his mum in Astoria for ten days so I will try to be systematic so i can maybe help other travelers.
Firstly the room was amazing. It was the basement of their home with a lot of space and a half bathroom. Really relaxing experience with all the privacy you want, a large TV with Netflix and Amazon  for those who like to watch a nice movie when coming back from a long day in New York. The photos on airbnb are not really capturing how nicely decorated and well kept is the room. Nothing compared to other rooms I have seen in Astoria. The towels provided are of very good quality and very large, the wi-fi works perfectly and there is plenty of space for your things. To me and after seeing a lot of rooms, there is no doubt that this one is the best taking into consideration the space provided, the location and the price asked!
The neighborhood was again really pretty. Very safe with lots of shops for food and interesting markets. I had the feeling and really wanted to go back to Astoria and walk around after a busy day in Manhattan. 4min walk to 30th station and 16 min ride to Lex avenue and the upper east side which in my opinion is the best area in NY 
I can't say enough about Gabe and his mum. Their hospitality was awesome! I was welcomed with a lot of snacks, fruits and a bottle of wine waiting for me when I arrived and kept coming during my stay. Gabe was answering immediately to all my texts and tried to sort out anything I needed in order to feel more at home! But besides that the most important thing is that both of them are very interesting and well educated people. You can have a lot of discussions about lots of things and learn, which at least for me is very important! I think I made some friends in NYC, which by the way is a truly amazing city.
Highly recommended, no need to look anywhere else! Thanks a lot guys.

Staying at Gabe's apartment was a domestic Experience with a capital E.

Gabe met me when I arrived and showed me the place. He had answers to my questions about the area and was good company while I settled in, great guy.

His guest floor includes a private entrance and bath, custom furniture laid out to fit the space, and enough artwork to befit a museum.

Let me count the ways I loved this place:
1) Laid out and available were snacks, coffee machine + spindle of flavor cups, water, and a toothbrush.
2) The place has style. I keep a good home but Gabe clearly has a future career as interior decorator awaiting him.
3) Plants! There's a garden of greenery spread around the apt.
4) Everything useful is labeled, from the lightswitches to the recycling bin.
5) There is a pre-sentient voice-activated music player in the living room. "Alexa play some Jazz". "Alexa louder". "Alexa next". I'll be getting one of these for myself, it's from Amazon apparently.

Hosts like Gabe make Airbnb amazing to use. I hope all my future hosts will be similarly excellent.

My boyfriend and I had a fantastic stay at Gabe's home. This is what AirBnb is all about! From the first moment, Gabe and his mother made us feel welcome and were eager to make our stay more comfortable. We were even provided with some food, fresh linen and towels! The room is better than as advertised and has all of the necessary amenities. The apartment is a short two minute walk to the nearest metro, and about a half hour train into Manhattan. I would highly recommend this room to anyone and will definitely return one day!

Very cozy, tidy and spacious suite, helpful and nice hosts. You get a huge room and restroom in the basement, separate entrance, shower and kitchen are shared, but considering it's NYC, it's a great deal. The metro is 5 min walk away, there are groceries, restaurants and gyms around. Gabriel was always there to answer all our silly questions and gave us good advice about anything we would ask. Would definitely recommend to anyone coming to explore the great city.

We had a really great stay at Gabe's! I mean no complaints at all!! 

The bed was super comfortable, the room was really beautiful, and the apartment was extremely nice. Gabe and his mother were very friendly, (we had the place to ourselves)  which was perfect although we were out wandering the city all day,  when we did see them upon arrival they were helpful, sweet, & very welcoming! The area is perfect, very close to the train, shops, cafés and some of the best food on this trip. Super nice block - nothing to worry about with a private entrance, that allows you to come and go freely. It was such a nice spot! The pictures do not give you what the experience will - it was great not having to NOT worry about anything.  

Gabe provided towels, toiletries, iron, Tylenol any and everything you may need on a trip (that you sometimes forget to pack). Thanks Gabe!

I totally recommend staying here, whether for a day or a month. The price is right and the place is even better :)

My girlfriend and I had an extended stay in Gabriel's Astoria location, and everything about it was absolutely perfect. Gabe is an incredible host, makes you feel like you're living in your own home (even provided a ridiculous amount of Keurig coffee for us), and gave us all the info and advice we needed to have a great time in the city. His home is beautiful and you are able to live in the entire lower floor, and it truly feels like you have your own personal space. We were both very comfortable for our whole trip and I cannot recommend staying with Gabe enough, it was a wonderful experience!

Gabe was the consummate host.  When (Hidden by Airbnb) maps misinformed us about the directions, he came to fetch us from the station.
Great location and ambiance.

Gabriel was an expert host. So friendly and on hand with any queries or questions. While talking one night he noticed the smallest piece of dirt on the floor(which I didnt notice) and immediately cleaned it up. He also has great knowledge about the local area which you should tap into.

Gabriels place is amazing and alot more space which the photos do not do justice. From the bed and couch being extremely comfortable to the shower and everything being immaculate it was just an absolute pleasure staying with Gabriel. By far the best airbnb experience I have had. Well done Gabriel you were a great host.

I had a fairly lengthy stay with Gabe at the apt when I was looking for my own place after moving to NYC.  Really a very comfortable place, almost like your own studio in that you have a relatively large basement room with toilet to yourself, your own entrance, etc.  They keep the place spotless an clean regularly, change sheets and towels, etc.  5 min walk to the N/Q train and lots of food, shopping etc very nearby.  Probably one of the best Airbnb options in Astoria and definitely way better (in terms of value for money) than any hotel, especially if you are staying for more than a few days.  

Bottom line - was very happy there and would stay again or reccommend to friends.

Gabriel and his mum were amazing and made us feel so comfortable right from the start of our holiday! The room we had was lovely, private, and spacious. Definitely will be staying here again! Thankyou Gabe and Mirta!
All good, clean and tidy and as promised.  Really close to subway so great location.

Gabriel's mother welcomed us at the arranged time. The apartment was modern and clean. Our downstairs space was large and private. It was especially nice to have our own half bath and separate entrance to the suite. Full kitchen and bath upstairs were always available. Neighborhood was safe and quiet. Very convenient location with subway and bus stops only 2 blocks away which makes for easy access to Laguardia airport or midtown Manhattan.
